trans-unit.source: Defines the metadata attribute that ASP.NET server controls use to specify whether they participate in loading view-state information by <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.ID"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateModeByIdAttribute> class is used to specify a control that requires view-state loading by <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A>.
The default view-state loading behavior is for ASP.NET to load the view-state information for a control by its index in the control tree of the page.

There is a performance cost for loading view-state information by <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> because the page control tree must be searched for the control specifically before loading its view-state information.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateModeByIdAttribute> class is used as a metadata attribute of a custom control class,
the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadViewStateByID%2A> property of the control returns `true`.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateModeByIdAttribute> class is not used, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadViewStateByID%2A> property of the control returns its default value of `false`, which means that the control does not load its view-state information by <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A>.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/30386922-1e00-4602-9ebf-526b271a8b87).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateModeByIdAttribute> class does not apply to saving the view-state information for a control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateModeByIdAttribute> class metadata attribute is valid only on class declarations.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ViewStateModeByIdAttribute"></xref> class.
Applying the <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateModeByIdAttribute> to a control class means that the control will have its view-state information loaded by <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A>.
